Question: This person was born on Milk Street, in Boston, Massachusetts, on January 17, 1706 and baptized at Old South Meeting House.
Hints: This person established a common-law marriage with Deborah Read on September 1, 1730.
This person left his apprenticeship without permission, and in so doing became a fugitive.
This person became a national hero in America when he spearheaded the effort to have Parliament repeal the unpopular Stamp Act.
